{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Motorola Solutions |model=AP 7532 |revision=(60740-US) |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=07/16/2014 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Wistron NeWeb |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=access point |fcc_id=UZ7AP7532 |ic_id= |us_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_poe=af |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM53016A1;BCM53016A1IFEBG, TT1410 P13, P9PS1-01 Z1A; |cpu1_cspeed=1 GHz |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=512 |fla1_brand=Spansion |fla1_model=S34ML04G100TFI00 |fla1_num= |ram1=256 |ram1_brand=Micron |ram1_model=MT41K128M16JT-125 IT:K |ram1_num= |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe (oversized) |expansion_minipcie_num=2 |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=Wistron NeWeb DNXB-M5I |wi1_module_if=Mini PCIe (oversized) |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM43460;BCM43460IMLG, TE1407 P20, 356796 3 W; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_module=Wistron NeWeb DNXB-M2I |wi2_module_if=Mini PCIe (oversized) |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM43460;BCM43460IMLG, TE1407 P20, 356796 3 W; |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL, RP-SMA |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=2 |wan_ports= |addl_chips=2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE2622L;SiGe, 2622L, 318CE;3;,,, 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE5003L1;5003L1, 402KA, 1402 MY;3; |flags= |stock_boot= |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=84:24:8D |oui_eth=84:24:8D }} '''802.11ac Dual Band 3x3 Wireless Access Point'''
There are multiple AP 7532 sold for various regions: *60740 models seem to be external antenna models *67030 models seem to use internal antennae only
OUI: 84:24:8D (''Zebra Technologies'') FCC ID: [https://fccid.io/UZ7 UZ7]
*"[G]48DNXBOF.OGB" and "2014.02.06" is silkscreened on :the blue 2.4GHz wireless module ''Wistron NeWeb DNXB-M2I'' *"[G]48DNXBOI.SGB" and "2014.03.06" is silkscreened on :the green 5GHz wireless module ''Wistron NeWeb DNXB-M5I'' *"[G]48RNAW04.SGC" and "2014.04.24" is silkscreened on :the main board AP 7532 (''WNC'' P/N: 4L-RAABM13-016) *AP-7532I-US marked by ''Symbol Technologies''
